expression: out of sight out of mind

selectionMeta.selectedPhrase: out of sight out of mind

step1.sentence: After she moved abroad, her old friends slowly stopped calling — out of sight, out of mind, as they say.

step2.story: When Marcus transferred to a remote office, his colleagues quickly forgot to include him in team discussions. Out of sight, out of mind — within weeks, decisions were being made without him. He realized he needed to speak up and stay visible, even from a distance.

step3.story: Elena had always been close to her college roommate, but after graduation they drifted to opposite sides of the country. At first they texted every day, but the messages grew shorter and further apart. Months passed, and Elena noticed she rarely thought about her old friend anymore. It was a painful reminder that out of sight really does mean out of mind, no matter how strong a bond once felt. She decided to call, determined not to let distance quietly erase what they had built. One conversation was enough to remind her that some friendships deserve more than passive hope.

meaning.literalMeaningKo: 눈에 보이지 않으면 마음에서도 잊혀진다는 의미이다.
meaning.realUsageKo: 멀리 떠난 사람이나 잊혀진 문제가 자연스럽게 관심에서 사라질 때 사용한다. 관계나 사물이 거리나 시간으로 인해 소홀해지는 상황을 설명할 때 자주 쓰인다.
meaning.etymologyKo: 13세기 영어 속담에서 유래했으며, 원래 형태는 'Out of sight, out of mind'로 기록되어 있다. 시각적 존재가 기억과 감정을 유지하는 데 얼마나 중요한지를 반영한 오래된 인간 경험에서 비롯된 표현이다.
meaning.nuanceKo: 다소 체념적이거나 쓸쓸한 어조를 담고 있으며, 때로는 자기 자신이나 타인의 망각을 정당화하거나 비판적으로 지적할 때도 사용된다. 부정적인 뉘앙스가 강하지만, 단순한 사실로서 중립적으로 쓰이기도 한다.
meaning.shortExampleEn: He deleted all her photos after the breakup — out of sight, out of mind.
meaning.shortExampleKo: 그는 이별 후 그녀의 사진을 모두 지웠다 — 눈에서 멀어지면 마음에서도 멀어지니까.
